text:
For Apache2 value for
apxs -q LDFLAGS_SHLIB 
is undefined even if Apache2 configured with --enable-so option.

This leads to linking errors when I trying build my own third party module using
apxs. When I force this value to '--shared' I have no linking errors.
creator: maxime@maxime.net.ru

text:
I believe this is the desired behavoir. On several different machines, none of
them had '--shared' set in LDFLAGS_SHLIB.

LDFLAGS_SHLIB should ony be for *extra* Flags needed for a shared lib, not for
'--shared'.
creator: chip@force-elite.com
maxime@maxime.net.ru
text:
Nope, on my machine I have '--shared' in LDFLAGS_SHLIB for Apache 1.3...
And I have *real* linking troubles without this for Apache 2...

creator: jorton@redhat.com
text:
Linking modules with 2.x should be done using libtool (e.g. found via `apxs -q
LIBTOOL`) which means it's no longer necessary to export (or for httpd to even
know) about platform-specific LDFLAGS needed to create DSOs.  Marking this as
WONTFIX.
